poem:
Title: Fiscal Rain in the Balance

In the sterile dawn of policy,
60bn quietly loom -
a behemoth's silhouette.
Oh, Hunt, your mandate convenes
with the fear trembling
in Citigroup's forecast.
Cautiously, the houses rise, 
price tags swollen –
a testament to assumption.
Productivity's dial hesitates at 0.9,
The Office wears a hopeful grin,
yet, the burden of balance lingers heavy,
in the half-light of possibility.
